meanings.definition: To make less intense or harsh
meanings.sent1: She was muting the bright colors by adding some gray to the painting.
meanings.sent2: The chef decided to mute the strong flavors of the dish with a hint of sweetness.
meanings.sent3: The sun was muting its blinding rays behind a fluffy cloud.
meanings.sent4: His apology muted the anger in the room like a sudden rain shower in a heated argument.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used a soft tone to mute the excitement of the students before the exam.

meanings.definition: The act of reducing the volume of sound
meanings.sent1: The muting of the music made the party feel more intimate.
meanings.sent2: He adjusted the muting on the remote control to lower the TV volume.
meanings.sent3: The muting of the microphone caused an unexpected silence in the auditorium.
meanings.sent4: The muting of the background noise allowed her to focus on her reading like never before.
meanings.sent5: The muting of the traffic outside created a peaceful atmosphere in the room.

meanings.definition: Silencing or suppressing voices or sounds
meanings.sent1: The librarian was muting the loud chatter in the library by shushing the students.
meanings.sent2: The protesters were muting their chants as a sign of respect during the moment of silence.
meanings.sent3: The muting of the barking dog with a treat brought peace to the neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: Her smile had a muting effect on the heated argument, calming everyone down instantly.
meanings.sent5: The muting of the alarm clock by hitting snooze led to oversleeping for an important meeting.
